Game rating system
5 categories
all up to 10 points
Gameplay 7/10 - In depth, but a little rough on the edges
OST 0/10 - basic stock tracks
Replayability 10/10 - there is literally zero gameplay loop
Community 10/10 - dont interact with it at all
Specs 5/10 - it runs alright on a mid end pc (NVGA GTX 1080)

L'un de mes jeux préférés.

Toutefois la difficulté du mode carrière a été décuplée depuis les dernières mises à jour ; c'est dommage parce que la faillite attend 80% des entreprises ; au final on ne s'applique plus à faire de beaux véhicules pour avoir une société qui va de toute façon probablement mourir.  Même en mode décontracté cette difficulté est vraiment pénible.

L'intérêt majeur est encore de faire des véhicules pour BeamNG mais c'est vraiment dommage que la partie carrière ne soit pas plus appliquée.

185340736.review:
"Automation lets you build anything from the super realistic to the downright bonkers" - me

i can highly recommend this game to anyone who loves cars, engines and/pr design.
Automation has the added bonus of a partnership with BeamNg so you can import your creations and actually drive them, test them and crash them... as for automation i've had the game since super early access and it has come a long way.. at its core its always been a really fun game...

i'm writing this review now as i think it's at a state where it is extremely enjoyable to play, as it has me coming back to it here n there when i feel inspired to create something unique.. it has a career mode all be it a bit awkward still... but the game at its core is fantastic.. the detail and ability to shape cars and build out every detail including interiors now is great and will keep anyone entertained for hours.. the modding community is great if your someone who wants mods..

Automation lets you build anything from the super realistic to the downright bonkers.. 
so i highly recommend it to anyone whos reading this trying to decide whether or not to get it its fun game that even once you stop playing will have you coming back from time to time to build things in sandbox mode..

185309854.review: This is probably one the most addicting games I've ever played. I LOVE IT!!!

185284162.review:
Boy oh boy where do I even begin. Lebron.. honey, my pookie bear. I have loved you ever since I first laid eyes on you. The way you drive into the paint and strike fear into your enemies eyes. Your silky smooth touch around the rim, and that gorgeous jumpshot. I would do anything for you. I wish it were possible to freeze time so I would never have to watch you retire.

You had a rough childhood, but you never gave up hope. You are even amazing off the court, you're a great husband and father, sometimes I even call you dad. I forvever dread and weep, thinking of the day you will one day retire. I would sacrifice my ownlife it were the only thing that could puta smile on your beautiful face.

You have given me so much joy, and heartbreak over the years. I remember when you first left clevenland and its like my heart got broken into a million pieces. But a tear still fell frommy right eye when I watched you win yourfirst ring in miami, because deep down,my glorious king deserved it. I just wanted you to return home. Then allas, you did, my sweet baby boy came home and I rejoiced. 2015 was a hard year for us baby, but in 2016 you made history happen. You came back from 3-1 and I couldn't believe it.

I was crying, bawling even, and I heard my glorious king exclaim these words, "CLEVELAND, THIS IS FOR YOU!" Not only have you changed the game of basketball and the world forever, but you've eternally changed my world. And now you're getting older, but still the goat, my goat. I love you pookie bear, my glorious king, Lebron James.

185273161.review:
This would make a nice £10 add on to Beam ng but as a standalone game eh. i don't really see the tycoon side of it. its nice to be able to design cars here and then drive them on beam ng, but the designer is bad. not really for the exterior, that's kind of okay, but it falls apart bad trying to make interiors. 

There's a lot of customisation options it's really REALLY detailed and that's a good thing, but as someone who wants to get into it without years of research and experimenting its not the most inviting. I want to love it because this is my kind of game, its just executed poorly. 

a simple change to make this more inviting would be to add snap points to different items on the interior. a more user friendly widget for movement and rotation and a tutorial. 

if these changes were made I would pick the game up again. Refund given.

185137631.review:
Started campaign, earliest start date. Started to design a car. Started to design an engine. Can't continue because I need to select VVL but there's nothing to select from, not even "None".

Searched forum. Issues has existed since 2017.
Solutions seems to be starting at a later date (in that case, the earliest start date should be changed) or play on the beta branch of the game (so the devs have fixed the problem but refuse to release a hotfix?).
185137631.developer_response:
Thanks for the review.

If you're having gameplay issues with Automation, feel free to stop by our Discord for tips and help; our community is quite helpful and willing to answer questions as they come up, as is the Dev team, as needed.

We do not "withhold fixes"; we have a small dev team working on Automation and as such we need to make sure we work as efficiently as possible; fixes are worked on while we are working on new features for new updates, and breaking them out of that, unless it is a critical bug, generally means a lot of duplicated effort, time spent testing, etc., rather than delivering Automation to our players.

185095094.review:
So, nach fast 30 Stunden ziehe ich mein erstes Fazit:
Geniales Game
Man kann so kreativ sein wie man will. Denn es gibt quasi keine Grenzen.
Man kann unzählige verschiedene Motoren bauen.
Das Game sollte mittlerweile gefühlt auf nem Toaster laufen, sehr geile Performance.
Man kann sogar Innenräume machen wenn man will! 
Und man kann die Fahrzeuge sogar für BEAMNG exportieren!!!! WIE GEIL IST DAS DENN BITTE???
Und dank des Workshops (Schleichwerbung: Habe selber Inhalte darin veröffentlicht :P ) kann man das game quasi unendlich erweitern :D.

Leider gibt es auch Kritik zu vermelden:
Es kann mal passieren dass irgendein Lua Script Error aufploppt. FInde ich jetzt aber auch nicht weiter schlimm, da das Game anscheinend trotzdem meistens weiter läuft. Aber es ist trotzdem nervig ;)
Mein Tipp: Immer zwischenspeichern, dann passiert eurem Projekt auch im Normalfall nix! :P

Ich hoffe ich kann mit diesem Review den einen oder anderen helfen. :D

184935272.review:
Jogo muito bom, e a integração com o Beam ng Drive deixa isso muito interessante, porem só falta algumas coisas para ficar perfeito como um "modo avançado"

*opçoes para alterar o mapa de avanço de ignição (retirar picos de torque deixando a curva de torque mais plana e evitando quebra)
*Opçoes para alterar o mapa de combustivel (relação Rpm x Map) possibilitando um motor mais economico e forte
*opçoes do tamanho do coletor de admissão e escape (Metodo de Graham Bell) 
*efeitos do cabeçote como swirl, squish e tumble para redizir consumo de combustivel e detonação
*Sistemas de injeção Diesel
*Sincronização manual do VVT
*Adiantamento ou atraso do eixo comando de valvulas em motores sem VVT
*escolhas de diferentes eixos comando de valvula bem com tamanho das valvulas

184830000.review: Beh, dopo 700+ ore di gioco, penso di poter dire le cose come stanno. Ci gioco da anni, è il mio preferito tra questo e beamng. Una cosa "negativa" per molti che mi viene da dire...ci vuole testa, pazienza e costanza per fare una VERA e dico VERA auto, cosa che ormai non tutti hanno, preferendo mettere 2 fari e una griglia. Se sei come me, che va sempre più nei dettagli, allora rischi di rinchiuderti in stanza per molto tempo perchè ad esempio, per una sola macchina, personalmente impiego 5+ ore solo nel montaggio dei pezzi e sono anche abbastanza veloce nel metterli, ormai ho manualità nei comandi. per uno alle prime armi, può passare benissimo mezza giornata come me la prima volta, E SENZA FARE INTERNI MA A FINESTRE TOTAL BLACK!...quindi vi chiedo di non pensare e dire che sia un gioco noioso, perchè se lo pensiate, semplicemente non fa per voi. Le guide sono abbastanza da aiuto nel caso ci fosse sottosterzo o l'assetto troppo morbido...ma vorrei che si potessero disattivare, cosa che al momento non di può fare e mi da un po fastidio. Il simulatore del motore è fatto bene, ad esempio ho copiato perfettamente un G16A della Vitara mia, quindi TOP!!!. Per concludere non ho altro da aggiungere se non di continuare così e magari di aggiungere anche il wankel e derivati, l'hybrid anche se lo odio e non ne sono un fan e magari anche prototipi di motori.

184818155.review: Great game to play for fun & also if u wanna start learning automotive engeneering.

184813485.review:
The visual design phase was great, and going into it knowing a bit about cars I figured I'd learn some things and enjoy sculpting lots of cool vehicles. I started with a classic truck in campaign, there wasn't really much of a tutorial but the sliders often had explanations so I carefully read and picked settings I thought best fit my vision for the car and the demographic I wanted to sell to. That part was fun too, seeing all the changes, painting the engine parts to match this theme in my head etc. But then I reached the end of the engine design phase I saw the dreaded flashing '!' telling me just how bad everything was. I could understand if one setting made another incompatible, but letting it continue without some sort of explanation was frustrating. In design mode, you can't move a headlight where it won't fit; this should be the case with dangerous or unsatisfactory settings as well (With explanations!). Gratefully however, there was an 'AI Tune' button, that fixed everything for me and I went through and tried to notice the changes it made. Not much I really understood the significance of, but tried learning nonetheless. After spending what must've been an hour or two designing my first truck, I got to the settings for it. Already my truck was *maybe* over-engineered, with time overruns and the like, but I felt it was pretty close to my vision and was excited to progress the game and see how it goes next, make new models, cheaper models etc. Those settings I ran through caused many headaches though. I spent longer than I'd like to admit trying to fix the many warnings to no avail, then googling how to find the 'AI tune' button for this part too; none. I did find that the 'severe over steering' issue was likely a bug, however in final testing it sure sounded like it was over steering so idk. I also had minor notes about over steering which I corrected (but the severe one never went away??) There were complaints about the engine not having enough room, which didn't really make sense to solve because the suggestions caused other issues with breaks. Also lots of contradicting warnings if you haven't gathered already (break fade smfh). Still though after reading online that other people simply ignored a lot of these, and being pretty happy with my new truck, I went on to the next main phase and oh boy. After hours of what started fun but easily became frustrating and tedious, I expected the tycoon part of the game to at least be fulfilling in some way. It was a slog. I read through the demographics and nations, I knew people in Dalusia or whatever were wealthy and would supposedly like the truck. The truck took a couple years to enter production and I didn't really understand how releasing a '46 truck in '49 made sense. I had to quickly jump through factory screens, and get slammed with multiple tables and graphs and at some point you start to tune these things out ya know? I've gotten tired of them especially on the first attempt at anything. I'm pissing money away even though my truck is making decent profit, I cancelled my few research priorities. Then I sat there and just watched this calendar slowly creep across on 5x speed waiting for the truck which was apparently %160 affordable and %600 desirable (??) to make my money go up instead of bleed. And beyond putting some points into a spread sheet of research (expensive) or a spreadsheet of marketing (I don't know how beneficial it is) I could only really think of two things to do. I could I suppose start making another car for a few hours, make a facelift for the same truck which is still costing more than it's making and hasn't finished it's production cycle, or build some factories (expensive as hell).

 Ultimately though when it comes down to it, the bar for entry should be much simpler and streamlined. Learning details and fine-tuning should reward you, not be the bare minimum. More time in design, and much less (necessary) settings to play with, with those interactions resulting in better selling cars or more prestigious brands. When you spend a long time working on something, you want to admire it, this was the final blow for me through it all. The design is relegated to a thumbnail, the tycoon is a combination of like 6 spreadsheets and a map of the world only choosing new locations for factories (I'm sure it's used more but not enough). There's a ridiculous amount of tedious tweaks in every aspect of the game that either feel unimportant and ineffective or frustrating and elusive. Maybe a comprehensive tutorial to set you up, introducing aspects one at a time in the flow of the game *alongside* a much simpler setup to start playing. I saw that there were events, which can be cool if you're invested in your success. But without any enjoyable endgame I felt like I honestly wasted my time making the car, and although designing it was fun; it isn't enough to do it 15 more times without any other real fulfillment beyond numbers on my screen. The game needs some serious introspection to reach a it's full audience in the future, because right now I'm sure like half the people who buy this won't play it again after the first or second time. I usually like tedious and slow games, but this made me feel sad. (Edit: I thought this game was in early access or something and that's why it was missing features and wasn't fully fleshed out but turns out it's actually a decade old. So.)

184798448.review: very fun if you know what your doing would recomend watching a few tutorials on youtube first though

184796498.review:
Timeline:

- Purchased Game
- Made a Car without watching a tutorial
- Make the engine of the car (it knocked itself out)
- Spend time making the fixtures
- Become super proud and export it to BeamNG Drive (the game is compatible with BeamNG Drive)
- Joyride
- Close BeamNG and make another car project

184669076.review:
Overall Rating 8/10.

I have really enjoyed this game and have sunk many hours into it. Here is my list of of the things I have enjoyed the most and some constructive criticisms. 

What I have enjoyed:
 
-The creation, tuning, and customization of several engine types. Engines, as they should, really define the car. I am able to build similar engines, the same architecture and HP, but the performance can be completely different

-The visual customization is great, and I have never even used mods on this game. Overall I am able to create unique models and get pretty close to what I envisioned

-Multiple simulation test tracks to bench mark my performance

-Customization of the cars chassis, suspension, interior, tires, and brakes all affect thee performance of my vehicle. 

-The photo mode is great for capturing image of your cars

-The sound of the engine are unique across platforms and individual engines. They sound great.

-Continual game support and updates

What I have not utilized to the fullest:

-I do not have drive bmg, so I have not been able to physically drive my models, but you can import them into drive.

-Again, I have not used mods, but there seems to be a lot of mod support.

Things that need work or I was not a fan of:

-The campaign is really complex, which is not always a bad thing, but I found it too difficult for me personally. It has a lot of potential and this is a feature I really want to use, but for right now it does not seem to be worth my time.

-The cosmetics can become stale, but again I have sunk a lot of hours into this game.

-The cosmetics can be a bit buggy sometimes, especially when using them on angles or curves

-Sometimes larger engines with turbos will have the radiators protrude past the body. Maybe these engines shouldn't be allowed

184477874.review:
Игра очень спецефичная, подойдёт не всем, но я с огромным удовольствием провёл в ней 170 часов.

По-сути это игра-конструктор автомобильных двигателей и автомобилей. Их потом можно экспортировать в BeamNG и там покататься. Ещё можно просто любоваться на графички и подгонять параметры, чтобы стало ещё лучше.

В игре кузова и технологии 1946-2020 годов. Внимание к деталям и нюансам двигателей шикарное. Я ради интереса пробовал повторить и настроить всякие реальные двигатели - двигатели VW жука, автоваза, 2JZ-GTE, SR20, VK56, B16B, TSI, и даже мотоциклетные двигатели и двигатели грузовиков. Обычно получается что-то, отличающееся от реальных характеристик на +-10%, иногда +-30%. За это разработчикам огромный зачёт.

Ещё в игре есть режим компании, где надо управлять компанией-автопроизводителем. Тут вылазят забавные нюансы - кроме мощности двигателя важны стоимость и массовость производства, стоимость разработки, надёжность, шумность, экономичность, экологичность и т.п. Ещё интересно, что всякие технологии открываются не сразу и можно потихоньку разобраться с каждой. Это прикольно, но под конец компании с 1946 до 2020 мне уже надоело собирать и рестайлить десятки авто.

У игры есть какие-то пределы реализма и я до них дошёл. Я бы сказал, что лучше всего в игре получаются автомобили и бензиновые двигатели до 1990-2000 годов.

Дизельных и роторных двигателей нет. Конфигураций двигателей типа VR6 тоже нет, есть только inline, V c углом развала 60 и 90 и оппозитный. V10 с углом развала 72 градуса тоже нет, только с 90.

На моделировании мотоциклетных двигателей я упёрся в то, что игра не даёт поставить максимальный rpm выше 12000 и совсем маленькие цилиндры сделать не получится (например как в honda cb400)

Но то что есть, сделано с хорошим вниманием к деталям. Например, плавно работают V8 с углом развало 90 и v6 с углом 60, а вот V8 c 60 и V6 c 90 не такие плавные. А ещё на атмосферном двигателе важны длина и ширина впуска-выпуска, и можно получить заметную прибавку мощности на каких-то оборотах. Всё это прикольно сочетается с необходимостью уместить двигатель в машину и вписаться в какие-то ограничения.

Кузовов машин в игре целая куча, у них есть куча опций - материалы кузова, типы подвески, привода, коробки передач, расположение двигателя, аэродинамика и т.п. Эта часть мне показалась не такой увлекательной как редактирование двигателей, но она тоже есть и вполне хорошая.

Игру до сих пор развивают, недавно появилась альфа-версия обновления, где кроме турбо стало можно ставить нагнетатели или их комбинации типа двух последовательных турбин или турбину + нагнетатель.

К сожалению, в игре нельзя настроить разное давление наддува для разных оборотов и вообще настройка тубины довольно условная, но я думаю даже такого уровня детализации большинству игроков будет достаточно.

В общем, если вы автомобильный фанат и вам интересны автомобильные двигатели - покупайте, должно понравиться.

I can't in good conscience recommend this game.
It has all the great marks of a game that could be good, but progress has been slow over the years. This is another early access game that will never be released, its an unfinished product that will always remains as such and likely make good money doing so, paving the way for future half finished games.

DLC is a dirty word. DLC for an unfinished early access game is ludicrous.

If engines is your thing, then there's a free engine simulator you can download online.
184316873.developer_response:
Thank you for the review.

We remain committed to delivering Automation to our players with all of the features originally promised, and we continue to make good progress with every update toward that goal.  Yes development is slow, but more importantly it continues at a pace that is sustainable from a business perspective.

The V16 Supporter Pack is exactly that - in our original crowdfunding drive, we made a promise that if supporters backed us to a higher level, they would get access to V16 engines as a perk for their consideration.  The only way we could fulfill that promise to our backers was via a DLC.  That is the only reason why we have the V16 Supporter Pack.  

As for the Soundtrack, we don't actually see any money from that; 100 percent of the proceeds from soundtrack sales go to the composer.

184289242.review:
Automation is an awesome game for anyone into car design. Right from the start, you can tell the developers are passionate about making a great game, and it really shows. The customization options are top-notch, and you get to create your dream cars in incredible detail.

The engine design part is especially cool, with realistic physics that make it both fun and challenging. Plus, the developers are always listening to player feedback and keep updating the game to make it even better.

Overall, Automation is a must-play for car enthusiasts. The love and effort put into it shine through in every aspect, making it a super enjoyable experience. Can't wait to see what gets added in the future. Highly recommended! 🚗💨

184048225.review:
I don't need to say much about this game.
Camshaft patch bugs shortly after they're reported.
Base game is great, mods allow you to make nicer looking cars.
The designers are helpful, and tell you what is happening to your poor car when something fails, plus gives you helpful information to help fix the problem. (For example, let's say my engine is knocking, the engine designer tells me that I should try to reduce the turbo's boost, make the fuel map richer, or reduce the compression, and doing just that almost always fixes the issue.)
BeamNG exporter that allows you to export your car as a mod for BeamNG, no advanced JBeam though, so collisions will be weird, but driving will be perfectly fine.
And the current open beta, while it is buggy, actually fulfills a promise the devs had a long time ago before the port to Unreal Engine(which was superchargers) and actually makes the engine and car designing experience both more in depth and enjoyable!

183808301.developer_response:
Thank you for the review.

While it is true that we do not currently have tutorials in Automation, we still have our extensive tooltip system in-game, which provides explanations of what choices you are making.  We will be bringing tutorials back to Automation soon, however; we have been waiting for all this time because the game is still very much under development, and it doesn't make sense to spend the time and money making tutorials when major game mechanics are still in flux.

To the car designs: you can't design your cars as companies do it in real life, since some elements are not included, but if you mixture small design-elemets together it works great. Just that the car designing for newer players can turn out a little weird. I have experienced this "weird-designing" myself, by the fact that I'm also pretty new to this game. Now to the car stats: it is essential to balance everything out, and it can be a little hard to balance everything out, but if you get the drill everything would work out perfectly. The campaign is not one of the favourites on my side this game. But that doesn't mean that anyone else wouldn't adore it. Me personally, I think that this game is worth the money. There are some contras, but the pros make it up again. Very good game overall.
